definition: to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless

sentences.english: The cylindrical container has a wide -mouth opening for easy filling and convenient access to the contents.
sentences.chinese: 圆柱容器广泛张口，方便灌装和方便地访问内容。

sentences.english: Mouth breathing can be a problem, especially in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 张口呼吸本身就对健康不利，在冬季尤甚。

sentences.english: Even if as for is not at a loss for words, also can only be ambiguous at least.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至于张口结舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。

sentences.english: As long as you're not drooling or gawking, it can be sexy.
sentences.chinese: 只要你不流口水或张口瞠目，那么就是性感的。

sentences.english: No surprise that he would get the lion's share; it was, after all, his money.
sentences.chinese: 他如此狮子大张口是可以理解的，毕竟那都是他的钱。

sentences.english: The crowd gaped at the daring tricks performed by the tightrope walker.
sentences.chinese: 观众们张口注视着走绳索人大胆的表演。
彼得张口结舌答不上来。

sentences.english: Dehisce first breath, caused by dry lips and throat discomfort mucosa.
sentences.chinese: 首先要张口呼吸，引起口唇粘膜干燥和咽部不适。

sentences.english: He ran along the sidewalk, pulling in the cold air through his open mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他跑到沿线的人行道上，朝着冷空气通过他张口。

sentences.english: Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.
sentences.chinese: 你要大大张口，我就给你充满。

sentences.english: Even if not a loss for words, at least we can only vague.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至于张口结舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。

sentences.english: O liver tried to reply, but he was too weak to speak.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗想张口说话，可他虚弱得连话都说不出了。

sentences.english: The waves continued to pound violently, forcing me underwater and gasping for air.
sentences.chinese: 浪头继续狂暴地怒吼，我载浮载沉，不断张口喘气。

sentences.english: Treat the child even between husband and wife began to scold, the hand will play.
sentences.chinese: 对待孩子甚至是夫妻之间张口便骂，抬手便打。

sentences.english: There was no paresthesia , infection, or limitation of mouth opening after surgery.
sentences.chinese: 术后并无神经麻木及感染现象，亦无张口受限情况。

sentences.english: All the fshes he could fnd in all the sea he ate with his mouth—so!
sentences.chinese: 凡是在大海里能找到的鱼，他全都张口吃掉。

definition: to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
to swallow/to take
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to vomit/to throw up
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
to be just about to/to be on the point of
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
spittle/saliva
to swallow/to suppress
throat/larynx
